messages.content: What is ComfyUI Segment Anything based on?
ComfyUI Segment Anything is based on the work of [continue-revolution](https://github.com/continue-revolution) from `https://github.com/continue-revolution/sd-webui-segment-anything`.
How does ComfyUI Segment Anything ensure consistency with the original project?
The project ensures consistency with `sd-webui-segment-anything` by having the same output when given the same input.
What are the Python dependencies for ComfyUI Segment Anything and how do I install them?
The Python dependencies can be installed using the command `pip3 install -r requirements.txt`.
How are the models downloaded for ComfyUI Segment Anything?
The models are downloaded automatically when used, but they can also be downloaded manually as specified in the documentation.
What is the default location for the `bert-base-uncased` model if it is not downloaded manually?
The default location for the `bert-base-uncased` model is typically `~/.cache/huggingface/hub/models--bert-base-uncased`.
How can I download the `GroundingDino` models?
The `GroundingDino` models can be downloaded directly to the `models/grounding-dino` directory under the ComfyUI root directory without modifying the file names.
What are the available `SAM` model files and their respective sizes?
The available `SAM` models include: sam_vit_h (2.56GB), sam_vit_l (1.25GB), sam_vit_b (375MB), sam_hq_vit_h (2.57GB), sam_hq_vit_l (1.25GB), sam_hq_vit_b (379MB), and mobile_sam (39MB).
How can I contribute to the source code of ComfyUI Segment Anything?
To contribute to the source code, fork the project, make changes, commit, and then send a pull request for the project maintainer to review and potentially merge.
